description: For a batch of security controls and standards, identifies whether each control is currently enabled or disabled in a standard. Calls to this operation return a RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND_EXCEPTION error when the standard subscription for the association has a NOT_READY_FOR_UPDATES value for StandardsControlsUpdatable.

parameters.name: StandardsControlAssociationIds
parameters.description: An array with one or more objects that includes a security control (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a standard. This field is used to query the enablement status of a control in a specified standard. The security control ID or ARN is the same across standards. (dict) --- An array with one or more objects that includes a security control (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a standard. SecurityControlId (string) --- The unique identifier (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) of a security control across standards. StandardsArn (string) --- The ARN of a standard.

nested_items.name: StandardsControlAssociationDetails
nested_items.description: Provides the enablement status of a security control in a specified standard and other details for the control in relation to the specified standard.

nested_items.name: StandardsArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a security standard.

nested_items.name: SecurityControlId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of a security control across standards. Values for this field typically consist of an Amazon Web Services service name and a number, such as APIGateway.3.

nested_items.name: SecurityControlArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a security control across standards, such as arn:aws:securityhub:eu-central-1:123456789012:security-control/S3.1. This parameter doesn't mention a specific standard.

nested_items.name: AssociationStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a control is enabled or disabled in a specified standard.

nested_items.name: RelatedRequirements
nested_items.description: The requirement that underlies a control in the compliance framework related to the standard.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the enablement status of the control in the specified standard was last updated.

nested_items.name: UpdatedReason
nested_items.description: The reason for updating the enablement status of a control in a specified standard.

nested_items.name: StandardsControlTitle
nested_items.description: The title of a control. This field may reference a specific standard.

nested_items.name: StandardsControlDescription
nested_items.description: The description of a control. This typically summarizes how Security Hub evaluates the control and the conditions under which it produces a failed finding. This parameter may reference a specific standard.

nested_items.name: StandardsControlArns
nested_items.description: Provides the input parameter that Security Hub uses to call the UpdateStandardsControl API. This API can be used to enable or disable a control in a specified standard.

nested_items.name: UnprocessedAssociations
nested_items.description: A security control (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) whose enablement status in a specified standard cannot be returned.

nested_items.name: StandardsControlAssociationId
nested_items.description: An array with one or more objects that includes a security control (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a standard. This parameter shows the specific controls for which the enablement status couldn't be retrieved in specified standards when calling BatchUpdateStandardsControlAssociations.

nested_items.name: SecurityControlId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier (identified with SecurityControlId, SecurityControlArn, or a mix of both parameters) of a security control across standards.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code for the unprocessed standard and control association.

nested_items.name: ErrorReason
nested_items.description: The reason why the standard and control association was unprocessed.
